posts.title: Australia reelects Labor party
top_comments: For non-Australians, the Labor party is our left-leaning party. The Liberal Party (which is the conservative party) tried to take a page out of Trump’s book in its campaign, which resulted in this outcome. Honestly they would have had a much better chance if they’d stuck to their usual guns – Trump is not a popular figure among the majority of the populace (although this year a new party ran called “Trumpet of Patriots”, which has an undeniable “Make Australia Great Again” air to it. That party has so far earned over 2% of the vote… take from that what you will).

I love how being seen as having anything in common with Trump is the recipe for losing an election, and even losing their own seat. 

He’s a loser of a man, and is contagious.
And! Dutton likely to lose his seat. This is the #trumpeffect

Just as significant is that conservative party leader Peter Dutton (Temu Trump) has had about a 10% swing against him, so is now trailing in his own electorate and may lose his own seat

Edit: the media has now called that Dutton has lost his seat. Polls closed at 6pm, it’s now 8:50pm - it’s such a bloodbath that both of these have already been called.

Dickson had the opportunity to do the funniest thing possible, and they delivered.

After Poilievre, it’s now Dutton’s turn to lose his own seat.
Was real nervous that Liberal was gonna actually have a substantial turnout, thank god it was just in my head
Common sense returning to the Commonwealth.

Fuck Murdoch!!

Suck a fat one Spud, you abandoned your electorate during floods to attend billionaire fundraisers. Karma's a bitch
Welp, *that* potato is cooked.
The leader of the opposition lost his own seat. Not an ideal result for him, great for Australia though

posts.title: National Science Foundation Halts Funding Indefinitely
top_comments: This is so fucked! What's the point of taking intellectualism back to the fucking stone age?!??

Oh God...they told us right there in print what they were going to do and people laughed.  "Trump just being Trump" was the most common excuse I heard 

"He doesn't really mean it"  

Yeah none of us are laughing now...more like screaming in terror.

With all this "cost savings" they conveniently neglect to mention how much investment they're torching by preventing the completion of these studies.  Many years of scientific research and the funding that supported it will rot on the vine because they're effectively preventing the harvest.  They're f@#$&# liquidating taxpayer investments before they mature... At best to claim they saved a buck.  At worst to intentionally sabotage the government, the dollar, the country, and modern western society.
All of these things are traps set for anyone in the future who would try to fix the damage: they would have to spend a LOT of money to restart all these programs.

This is how you truly crash the economy.

Cut all funding to science, thus stifling the innovation and invention that drives the economy.
"Hell is empty, and all the devils are here."
If you don't have a sense for scale, this is IMO the biggest news in weeks. Smart people can't do stuff without their NSF grants. Wow.
Wow, I don't think ppl understand the gravity of this news. Sadly, without scientists they won't have anyone to explain it to them either. This would shutdown most University STEM research programs.
Looks like we just maxed the tech tree for this playthrough.
I'm funded through the NSF. Overall, the atmosphere in research has been incredibly dim. No one sees even the slightest light at the end of the tunnel.

posts.title: Man sentenced to 53 years in prison in hate crime murder of 6-year-old Palestinian-American boy
top_comments:
An Illinois man has been sentenced to 53 years in prison for the 2023 fatal stabbing of a 6-year-old Palestinian-American boy.

Wadee Alfayoumi was stabbed 26 times and his mother more than a dozen in the Oct. 14, 2023, attack inside their home in the Chicago suburb of Plainfield.

Their landlord, 73-year-old Joseph Czuba, was convicted in February on multiple murder charges, as well as attempted murder, aggravated battery and hate crime counts. A Will County jury found Czuba guilty of all counts after deliberating for less than two hours.

Authorities said he targeted his tenants because they were Muslim and in response to the war between Israel and Hamas that had just ignited after Hamas' Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel.

Wadee's great uncle, Mahmoud Yousef, addressed the sentencing outside the courthouse, telling reporters, "It doesn't matter what numbers are. He took a life from us. He took a future."

The child's mother, Hanan Shaheen, was the first to take the stand in the weeklong trial.

She said Czuba attacked her first with a knife, stabbing her multiple times, saying, "You devil Muslim, you must die," as her son watched, according  to WLS, which was in the courtroom.

She testified that she called 911 from the bathroom when he appeared to leave, but then she started to hear her son screaming, according to WLS.

"I started hearing my son screaming, screaming, screaming, 'Oh no, stop,'" Shaheen said, according to WLS.

Jurors also listened to the mother's 911 call from the bathroom, in which she was heard telling the dispatcher, "He's killing my baby," WLS reported.

Jurors additionally heard remarks Czuba made in a law enforcement vehicle following the attack.

"I thought they were going to do jihad on me," Czuba said, according to WLS.

He also said he was "afraid for my life" and his wife and said the family was "just like infested rats," according to WLS.
No matter what your political, social, cultural or religious views are, if you are killing a 6 year old as result of it, you are wrong.
I initially thought, “damn, only 53 years?” But then I realized he’s already an old POS.

"I thought they were going to do jihad on me," Czuba said, according to WLS.


World's smartest islamophobe
[removed]
There is a special circle of hell for people like this.
It’s amazing how religious fanatics claim they love god, and think they are better than everyone else, but yet they do the work of the devil, or whatever they call him in their religion.

Omg poor little boy. May he RIP.  Anyone that hurts a child is just a monster 

I really wish reddit didn’t have the news just in the middle of scrolling and saw this post, it’s so depressing and heartbreaking. As someone with a young son it just brings me such anxiety and pain to read stories of kids being killed :(
This guy can rot in hell, murdering a 5-year old for his religion, there are no words
You can thank Fox News and all the other right wing media for the death of this child.

posts.title: Conservative MP will resign Alberta riding so Poilievre can run again | Globalnews.ca
top_comments: Say what you want, but this is a little bit embarrassing for him.
Nothing says personal responsibility like blowing a 27-point lead, losing your own seat, then getting someone else to take the fall.
Doesn’t really seem right, losing your riding so just picking another, guaranteed riding. Not really the will of the people who voted against you.

I know this is common in Westminster parliamentary systems but I don't like this. If you lose, you lose. He's not really a resident of that Alberta riding/district. He's just pretending to be. (Yes I know district shopping happens in America too. I don't like it either).

A MMP legislature with party lists would solve this issue and have the added effect of allowing voters to be better represented in parliament.

God damn it. This is my riding. 
I guess I'll get the chance to call him a cunt in person.
Here's hoping Poilievre gets embarrassed again!
It would be fucking hilarious if he loses again

Let him run

Let him run for PM for the rest of his life

His policies suck, he sucks, he's a shit person and a has a shitty personality.

My boss is super conservative and just before the election he was very vocal about "if you lose your seat you should be fired". You lose your out mentality.

Strangely, he hasn't brought it up since the election!

posts.title: Former Illinois Gov. George Ryan dies at 91. He halted executions and went to prison for corruption
top_comments: TLDR; Former Illinois Governor George Ryan passed away on May 2, 2025, at the age of 91 in Kankakee, Illinois, while under hospice care. A Republican known for his pragmatism, Ryan served as governor from 1999 to 2003. He gained international recognition for halting executions and commuting all death row sentences in Illinois, citing systemic injustices in the capital punishment system. However, his career was marred by a corruption scandal dating back to his tenure as secretary of state, leading to a 2006 conviction for racketeering, bribery, extortion, money laundering, and tax fraud. He served over five years in federal prison and was released in 2013.

A relative met him and he was quite kind, goofy, and grandfatherly - at a time when we had just lost ours. It's a shame he marred his name with corruption. IL's 'wiretap' laws (all party consent everywhere audio recording) basically exist to protect this kind of crap, so it's no wonder IL's history of corruption is long and deep.
At the time, I cynically though that clearing death row was a bid for some kind of legacy to distract from licenses for bribes. The ordering of his obituary suggests it worked.

>Maurene Comey, an assistant United States attorney, said a guilty plea would have reduced the amount of prison time Combs would be exposed to compared to a trial conviction on all counts, which could result in what is effectively a life sentence.

He brought on a new lawyer earlier this week. And is first lawyer was allowed to leave in February.
Diddy is one of those people who will just continue being a creep. He shouldn't be in society at any age.
While most regular people would take a plea from the feds, someone of Diddy's level of fame and wealth usually never does so this is not surprising.
Prosecutors better not mess this up.
[removed]

Dude's 55. Considering the seriousness of the allegations, it might be a life sentence for him regardless. I'd bet the best he could've gotten was the potential for parole, but he's almost certainly not getting that now.

The thing a lot of people seem to miss is that Diddy is the lone defendant named in the case involving racketeering, conspiracy, sex trafficking and prostitution, according to the [US DOJ] (https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/media/1368556/dl) criminal filing.

Convincing a jury that he didn't have any help or  no one else involved 
in a criminal enterprise was worthy of being named as defendants in a RICO case is wild.  

Gonna be interesting to see how this all plays out.
I wonder what kind of leverage he has in order to pursue this route
He really is one of those people who should do the *opposite* of whatever they think they should do.

posts.title: Leak: EU governments double down on penalising privacy-friendly and encrypted messaging services with chat control bulk scanning orders
top_comments: The fact that they never had any issue with Whatsapp despite it being by far the largest messaging platform in the EU with claims of End to end encryption tells you exactly how secure it is.
The EU wants to keep an eye on how people use cryptocurrencies and is not happy with privacy tools like VPNs, Signal, TOR, and encrypted email services.

there is a tom scott video about this topic. 

https://youtu.be/CINVwWHlzTY?si=GuRohk1PBFVfqJqC

tldw, should police/government be able to break down a locked door to rescue someone? read a terrorists physical mail to find the location of a bomb after getting a legal search warrant? 

one way to view encryption laws are to view them as an extension of these existing laws. this is a steel man argument ie the strongest defence of the idea. it's worth thinking about the possible utility as well as the drawbacks.

posts.title: Man sentenced to 53 years in prison in hate crime murder of 6-year-old Palestinian-American boy
top_comments:
An Illinois man has been sentenced to 53 years in prison for the 2023 fatal stabbing of a 6-year-old Palestinian-American boy.

Wadee Alfayoumi was stabbed 26 times and his mother more than a dozen in the Oct. 14, 2023, attack inside their home in the Chicago suburb of Plainfield.

Authorities said he targeted his tenants because they were Muslim and in response to the war between Israel and Hamas that had just ignited after Hamas' Oct. 7, 2023, attack on Israel.

The child's mother, Hanan Shaheen, was the first to take the stand in the weeklong trial.

She testified that she called 911 from the bathroom when he appeared to leave, but then she started to hear her son screaming, according to WLS.

Jurors also listened to the mother's 911 call from the bathroom, in which she was heard telling the dispatcher, "He's killing my baby," WLS reported.

Jurors additionally heard remarks Czuba made in a law enforcement vehicle following the attack.

"I thought they were going to do jihad on me," Czuba said, according to WLS.

He also said he was "afraid for my life" and his wife and said the family was "just like infested rats," according to WLS.
No matter what your political, social, cultural or religious views are, if you are killing a 6 year old as result of it, you are wrong.
I initially thought, “damn, only 53 years?” But then I realized he’s already an old POS.

"I thought they were going to do jihad on me," Czuba said, according to WLS.

posts.title: Conservative MP will resign Alberta riding so Poilievre can run again | Globalnews.ca
top_comments: Say what you want, but this is a little bit embarrassing for him.
Nothing says personal responsibility like blowing a 27-point lead, losing your own seat, then getting someone else to take the fall.

I know this is common in Westminster parliamentary systems but I don't like this. If you lose, you lose. He's not really a resident of that Alberta riding/district. He's just pretending to be. (Yes I know district shopping happens in America too. I don't like it either).

A MMP legislature with party lists would solve this issue and have the added effect of allowing voters to be better represented in parliament.

posts.title: Former Illinois Gov. George Ryan dies at 91. He halted executions and went to prison for corruption
top_comments: TLDR; Former Illinois Governor George Ryan passed away on May 2, 2025, at the age of 91 in Kankakee, Illinois, while under hospice care. A Republican known for his pragmatism, Ryan served as governor from 1999 to 2003. He gained international recognition for halting executions and commuting all death row sentences in Illinois, citing systemic injustices in the capital punishment system. However, his career was marred by a corruption scandal dating back to his tenure as secretary of state, leading to a 2006 conviction for racketeering, bribery, extortion, money laundering, and tax fraud. He served over five years in federal prison and was released in 2013.

A relative met him and he was quite kind, goofy, and grandfatherly - at a time when we had just lost ours. It's a shame he marred his name with corruption. IL's 'wiretap' laws (all party consent everywhere audio recording) basically exist to protect this kind of crap, so it's no wonder IL's history of corruption is long and deep.
At the time, I cynically though that clearing death row was a bid for some kind of legacy to distract from licenses for bribes. The ordering of his obituary suggests it worked.
